intro: Rokautskyia whitmanii, commonly known as the Whitman's rokautskyia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
